meanings.definition: A person who begets or brings into being; father or male parent.
meanings.sent1: My genitors always support me in everything I do.
meanings.sent2: The genitors of the family worked hard to provide for their children.
meanings.sent3: The genitors were proud to see their child graduate from college.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the wise old man was considered the genitor of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The genitors' love for their children knows no bounds.

meanings.sent1: Our genitors came from a long line of skilled craftsmen.
meanings.sent2: Learning about our genitors helps us understand our heritage.
meanings.sent3: The genitors of the tribe were honored during the annual celebration.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tree is considered the genitor of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The genitors' traditions have been passed down for generations.

meanings.sent1: The genitors of the newborn were overjoyed with their new arrival.
meanings.sent2: The hospital provided support for new genitors in caring for their baby.
meanings.sent3: The genitors were amazed by the baby's tiny fingers and toes.
meanings.sent4: Nature acts as the genitor of all living beings.
meanings.sent5: The genitors' bond with their child is unbreakable.
